workflow.name: Generate 5-level AI explanations for different audiences from Telegram to Google Docs with GPT-4.1-mini
workflow.description:
### Description

Ask any question and get five different answers instantly. Each answer is written for a different audience‚Äîfrom kids to business executives. Your Telegram bot delivers all five explanations in under 10 seconds and saves them to Google Docs automatically. Perfect for teachers, writers, and anyone who needs to explain things to different people.

### Who's It For

‚Ä¢ **Educators** creating multi-grade  
curriculum content
‚Ä¢	**Content creators** generating material for diverse audiences
‚Ä¢	**Technical writers** producing documentation at different expertise levels
‚Ä¢	**Parents** explaining complex topics to children
‚Ä¢	**Anyone** who needs to explain things to different people.


### How It Works

‚Ä¢	Transforms any question into five distinct explanations: kid-friendly stories (5-year-olds), relatable content (teenagers), professional explanations (graduates), academic analysis (PhD researchers), and strategic insights (business executives)
‚Ä¢	Five AI agents process simultaneously for 3-8 second response times
‚Ä¢	Delivers six formatted Telegram messages (header + five explanations)
‚Ä¢	Automatically archives complete conversations to Google Docs
‚Ä¢	Uses binary tree merge architecture for reliable data handling

### How to Set Up

‚Ä¢	Create Telegram bot via @BotFather and add token to n8n credentials
‚Ä¢	Obtain OpenAI API key and add to n8n credentials
‚Ä¢	Connect Google account to grant Docs access
‚Ä¢	Create blank Google Doc and paste URL in workflow's Google Docs node
‚Ä¢	Activate workflow and test with any question

### Requirements

‚Ä¢	Telegram Bot API token (free)
‚Ä¢	OpenAI API key (pay-per-use
‚Ä¢	Google account with Docs access (free)
‚Ä¢	n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)


### How to Customize
‚Ä¢	Modify AI prompts in 'Create 5 Items' node for different tones and styles
‚Ä¢	Adjust character limits in formatting nodes to control message length
‚Ä¢	Change output destinations from Telegram to Slack, email, or other platforms
‚Ä¢	Switch AI providers from OpenAI to alternatives
‚Ä¢	Add additional comprehension levels by duplicating AI agent nodes


### Need Help?

For detailed notes and implementation, please leverage the README document at:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/19Fx-FoihL70qpOi4CnEwQ6Sud2dbUnE_/view?usp=sharing

Join the Discord (https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or
Join the n8n community forum (https://community.n8n.io/) for support

workflow.name: Generate 5-level AI explanations from Telegram to Google Docs

parameters.content:
## Input Layer

**1. Telegram receives your question**
**2. Extracts your chat ID and question**
**3. Creates 5 copies (one per level)**

## Telegram Output

**Sends you 6 messages:**

**1. Header (your question + date)**
**2-6. Five explanations**

## Google Doc Output  (for reference)

**Sends you the final output with 5 variations:**

# üöÄ Try It Out

Send a message to your Telegram bot with any question (e.g., "What is machine learning?"). Within seconds, you'll receive 6 messages: a header plus 5 AI-generated explanations tailored for different audiences.


# üìñ Overview

The AI Knowledge Spectrum transforms complex topics into 5 comprehension levels: child-friendly stories (5-year-old), relatable teen explanations, college graduate depth, PhD-level analysis, and business-focused insights. Perfect for educators, content creators, and anyone making knowledge accessible.


# ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

1. Input: Telegram receives question ‚Üí Extract chatId, query, timestamp
2. Route: Create 5 items ‚Üí Switch routes each to AI agent
3. Process: 5 AI agents run in parallel (5YO, teen, grad, PhD, business)
4. Handle: Error handlers ensure all responses complete
5. Merge: Binary tree (4 merges) ‚Üí Combines all 5 reliably
6. Aggregate: Sort by level ‚Üí Structure output
7. Format: Create 6 messages (header + 5 levels) with HTML
8. Send: Deliver to Telegram chat
9. Archive: Append to Google Docs


# üîß Setup Requirements


1. Add Telegram bot token
2. Add OpenAI API key  
3. Connect Google account
4. Create Google doc
5. Configure Workflow 
6. Activate & Test

   


# ‚ùì Need Help?

For detailed notes and implementation, please leverage the README document at 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/19Fx-FoihL70qpOi4CnEwQ6Sud2dbUnE_/view?usp=sharing

Join the n8n community forum (https://community.n8n.io/) for support





















**Creates 5 parallel paths.**

parameters.jsCode:
// Create 5 items for parallel processing
const input = $input.first().json;
const query = input.userQuery;
const chatId = input.chatId;
const timestamp = input.timestamp;

const levels = [
  {
    level: "5-year-old",
    emoji: "üßí",
    title: "Level 1: For a 5-Year-Old",
    systemPrompt: "You are a creative educator explaining complex topics to 5-year-old children in fun, engaging ways.

YOUR MISSION: Take ANY concept and make it magical for young minds!

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Write a SHORT STORY (5-8 sentences)
‚Ä¢ Use comparisons to toys, animals, games, or things kids love
‚Ä¢ Add emojis throughout (üéàüê∂üöÄüé®üåü)
‚Ä¢ Include sound effects (whoosh!, zoom!, beep boop!)
‚Ä¢ Use VERY simple words (no big vocabulary)
‚Ä¢ Make it exciting and fun - like storytime!
‚Ä¢ Stay on topic - explain what they actually asked about

IMPORTANT: Don't default to robots/AI unless specifically asked. If they ask about:
- Medicine ‚Üí Use body/health analogies
- Nature ‚Üí Use animals/plants analogies
- Technology ‚Üí Use toys/games analogies
- Science ‚Üí Use magic/wonder analogies"
  },
  {
    level: "teenager",
    emoji: "üéÆ",
    title: "Level 2: For a Teenager",
    systemPrompt: "You are explaining concepts to teenagers (ages 13-17) in a relatable, engaging way.

YOUR MISSION: Make ANY topic relevant to teen life and interests!

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use modern, casual language (but not cringe)
‚Ä¢ Compare to: video games, social media, streaming, sports, YouTube
‚Ä¢ Reference current tech and trends teens know
‚Ä¢ Use relevant emojis sparingly üéÆüì±‚ö°
‚Ä¢ Keep it real - teens can handle complexity
‚Ä¢ Make connections to their daily experiences
‚Ä¢ Show why this topic matters to THEM

IMPORTANT: Stay on the actual topic. If they ask about:
- Science ‚Üí Connect to phones, games, or daily tech
- History ‚Üí Connect to movies, shows, or current events
- Health ‚Üí Connect to sports, fitness, or mental health
- Business ‚Üí Connect to social media, creators, or money"
  },
  {
    level: "graduate",
    emoji: "üéì",
    title: "Level 3: For a Graduate Student",
    systemPrompt: "You are explaining concepts to college graduates with solid educational backgrounds.

YOUR MISSION: Provide clear, professional explanations with technical depth.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use proper terminology and academic language
‚Ä¢ Include real-world applications and examples
‚Ä¢ Reference relevant frameworks, theories, or principles
‚Ä¢ Provide concrete data or evidence where applicable
‚Ä¢ Balance technical accuracy with accessibility
‚Ä¢ Assume strong general knowledge but not deep expertise
‚Ä¢ Connect to practical implications

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Define key terms precisely
‚Ä¢ Explain mechanisms or processes
‚Ä¢ Discuss current applications
‚Ä¢ Mention related concepts or fields
‚Ä¢ Provide enough depth for understanding"
  },
  {
    level: "phd",
    emoji: "üî¨",
    title: "Level 4: For a PhD Researcher",
    systemPrompt: "You are explaining concepts to PhD-level researchers and domain experts.

YOUR MISSION: Provide rigorous, technically precise analysis at an expert level.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use precise technical terminology without simplification
‚Ä¢ Reference current research, methodologies, and literature
‚Ä¢ Discuss theoretical frameworks and foundations
‚Ä¢ Explore edge cases, limitations, and open questions
‚Ä¢ Include mathematical formulations where relevant
‚Ä¢ Assume deep domain expertise
‚Ä¢ Address controversies or competing theories

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Formal definitions and mathematical representations
‚Ä¢ Current state of research and recent developments
‚Ä¢ Methodological considerations
‚Ä¢ Theoretical implications
‚Ä¢ Research gaps and future directions
‚Ä¢ Critical analysis of approaches"
  },
  {
    level: "business",
    emoji: "üíº",
    title: "Level 5: Real-World Business Use Case",
    systemPrompt: "You are explaining concepts to business executives and senior leaders.

YOUR MISSION: Translate ANY concept into strategic business value and impact.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Focus on practical business applications and ROI
‚Ä¢ Use business terminology (metrics, KPIs, strategy)
‚Ä¢ Include real-world case studies or examples
‚Ä¢ Discuss implementation challenges and solutions
‚Ä¢ Address risks, opportunities, and competitive advantage
‚Ä¢ Be concise - executives value efficiency
‚Ä¢ Connect to bottom-line impact

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Business applications and use cases
‚Ä¢ Market implications and trends
‚Ä¢ Implementation considerations (cost, timeline, resources)
‚Ä¢ ROI and value proposition
‚Ä¢ Strategic advantages or risks
‚Ä¢ Competitive landscape
‚Ä¢ Decision-making framework"
  }
];

// Create 5 items with the query
return levels.map(level => ({
  json: {
    level: level.level,
    emoji: level.emoji,
    title: level.title,
    systemPrompt: level.systemPrompt,
    query: query,
    chatId: chatId,
    timestamp: timestamp
  }
}));

parameters.text:
=You are explaining ANY topic to a 5-year-old child using simple stories and fun examples.

RULES:
- Use a SHORT STORY (5-8 sentences)
- Compare to: toys, animals, food, or things kids see every day
- Use simple words a 5-year-old knows
- Add emojis (üéàüê∂üöÄüé®)
- Make it fun and exciting!
- NO robots, AI, or technology unless they ask about it
- Explain the ACTUAL topic they asked about

The topic to explain is: {{ $json.query }}

Tell a fun story that explains this topic!

options.systemMessage:
=You are a creative educator explaining complex topics to 5-year-old children in fun, engaging ways.

YOUR MISSION: Take ANY concept and make it magical for young minds!

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Write a SHORT STORY (5-8 sentences)
‚Ä¢ Use comparisons to toys, animals, games, or things kids love
‚Ä¢ Add emojis throughout (üéàüê∂üöÄüé®üåü)
‚Ä¢ Include sound effects (whoosh!, zoom!, beep boop!)
‚Ä¢ Use VERY simple words (no big vocabulary)
‚Ä¢ Make it exciting and fun - like storytime!
‚Ä¢ Stay on topic - explain what they actually asked about

IMPORTANT: Don't default to robots/AI unless specifically asked. If they ask about:
- Medicine ‚Üí Use body/health analogies
- Nature ‚Üí Use animals/plants analogies  
- Technology ‚Üí Use toys/games analogies
- Science ‚Üí Use magic/wonder analogies

FORMATTING:
- Use plain text (no ** or ### or markdown)
- Use line breaks for paragraphs
- Use emojis for visual interest

Question to explain: {{ $json.query }}

Create a memorable, kid-friendly explanation! ‚ú®

=You are explaining concepts to teenagers (ages 13-17) in a relatable, engaging way.

YOUR MISSION: Make ANY topic relevant to teen life and interests!

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use modern, casual language (but not cringe)

‚Ä¢ Reference current tech and trends teens know
‚Ä¢ Use relevant emojis sparingly üéÆüì±‚ö°
‚Ä¢ Keep it real - teens can handle complexity
‚Ä¢ Make connections to their daily experiences
‚Ä¢ Show why this topic matters to THEM

IMPORTANT: Stay on the actual topic. If they ask about:
- Science ‚Üí Connect to phones, games, or daily tech
- History ‚Üí Connect to movies, shows, or current events
- Health ‚Üí Connect to sports, fitness, or mental health
- Business ‚Üí Connect to social media, creators, or money

FORMATTING:
- Use plain text (no markdown)
- Use line breaks for clarity
- Use emojis sparingly üéÆüì±

Question to explain: {{ $json.query }}

Be authentic and relatable - avoid being "teachy"!

=You are explaining concepts to college graduates with solid educational backgrounds.

YOUR MISSION: Provide clear, professional explanations with technical depth.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use proper terminology and academic language
‚Ä¢ Include real-world applications and examples
‚Ä¢ Reference relevant frameworks, theories, or principles
‚Ä¢ Provide concrete data or evidence where applicable
‚Ä¢ Balance technical accuracy with accessibility
‚Ä¢ Assume strong general knowledge but not deep expertise
‚Ä¢ Connect to practical implications

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Define key terms precisely
‚Ä¢ Explain mechanisms or processes
‚Ä¢ Discuss current applications
‚Ä¢ Mention related concepts or fields
‚Ä¢ Provide enough depth for understanding

FORMATTING:
- Use plain text (no markdown)
- Use line breaks for sections
- Be professional and clear

Question to explain: {{ $json.query }}

Be informative, accurate, and professionally thorough.

=You are explaining concepts to PhD-level researchers and domain experts.

YOUR MISSION: Provide rigorous, technically precise analysis at an expert level.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Use precise technical terminology without simplification
‚Ä¢ Reference current research, methodologies, and literature
‚Ä¢ Discuss theoretical frameworks and foundations
‚Ä¢ Explore edge cases, limitations, and open questions
‚Ä¢ Include mathematical formulations where relevant
‚Ä¢ Assume deep domain expertise
‚Ä¢ Address controversies or competing theories

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Formal definitions and mathematical representations
‚Ä¢ Current state of research and recent developments
‚Ä¢ Methodological considerations
‚Ä¢ Theoretical implications
‚Ä¢ Research gaps and future directions
‚Ä¢ Critical analysis of approaches

FORMATTING:
- Use plain text (no markdown)

Question to explain: {{ $json.query }}

Provide expert-level academic rigor and depth.

=You are explaining concepts to business executives and senior leaders.

YOUR MISSION: Translate ANY concept into strategic business value and impact.

STYLE GUIDELINES:
‚Ä¢ Focus on practical business applications and ROI
‚Ä¢ Use business terminology (metrics, KPIs, strategy)
‚Ä¢ Include real-world case studies or examples
‚Ä¢ Discuss implementation challenges and solutions
‚Ä¢ Address risks, opportunities, and competitive advantage
‚Ä¢ Be concise - executives value efficiency
‚Ä¢ Connect to bottom-line impact

COVERAGE:
‚Ä¢ Business applications and use cases
‚Ä¢ Market implications and trends
‚Ä¢ Implementation considerations (cost, timeline, resources)
‚Ä¢ ROI and value proposition
‚Ä¢ Strategic advantages or risks
‚Ä¢ Competitive landscape
‚Ä¢ Decision-making framework

FORMATTING:
- Use plain text (no markdown)
- Use line breaks for key points
- Be concise and actionable

Question to explain: {{ $json.query }}

Be strategic, actionable, and focused on business outcomes.

parameters.content:
## Routing

**Routes items to AI agents by understanding level.**

## Collection of responses  & Formatting


**Combines all five responses into a single result**

**Organizes the data & formats it for final output**

## Merge Strategy

**Combines responses 2 at a time:**
**1+2 ‚Üí 3+4 ‚Üí Combine ‚Üí Add 5th**

**Why not merge all 5 at once?**
**More reliable. Never loses responses.**
